Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Peptide 5 (a fragment of an  Uncharacterized protein APU46894.1, Gly-rich; natural AMPs; bacteria, prokaryotes, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: Lactobacillus fermentumstrain HF-D1, from the human microbiota:gut, symbiont bacteria

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (41.4%) tofrog Thaulin-1. A fragment precipitated from the culture liquid at 80% ammonium sulphate. 28% G; 20% V, 16% A; GRAVY, 0.944; Mol Wt: 2247.58; Mol formula: C102H163N27O30; Mol ex coeff: 0.Activity: Active against rod-shaped Gram- bacteria S. marcescens and P. aeruginosa. A suggested name for peptide 5 is fermentin.
Literature Information.Author: Pavlova AS, Ozhegov GD, Arapidi GP, Butenko IO, Fomin ES, Alemasov NA, Afonnikov DA, Yarullina DR, Ivanov VT, Govorun VM, Kayumov AR.  2020 Russia, Asia, Europe
Literature Information.Title: Identification of Antimicrobial Peptides From Novel Lactobacillus Fermentum Strain
